PolicyPage.Name: 5.02 Incomplete Contracts
PolicyPage.Title: Incomplete Contracts
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
An Incomplete Contract is initiated with extenuating circumstances have occurred which hinder the students ability to complete the course work after the tenth week of a semester.  An Incomplete grade (I) is a conditional grade. The instructor approval is mandatory, as they will be required to work individually with the student in addition to their normal work load.

If an incomplete contract is necessary the instructor should first review the I-Contract Guidelines. Then email the student outlining the requirements of the contract.

Be sure to include:

  • Student name, email address & I-Number
  • Instructor name, course, section number, and term
  • Description of the circumstances around the incomplete
  • If it occurred after the 10th week of class (Yes or No)
  • If the student had a passing grade? (Yes or No)
  • If you feel you can assist the student in completion? (Yes or No)
  • What the student needs to do in order to finish the course
  • The required date to complete the course

Once the instructor has received the student's response, they will forward the full email to: onlinelearning@byui.edu. OSC students will log the contract as a ticket and forward the email to Student Records and Registration.
